thread.title: Orlando City announces sellout for 2017 season opener
thread.title_full: Orlando City announces sellout for 2017 season opener

author: Alicia DelGallo
title: Orlando City announces sellout for 2017 season opener
text:
Orlando City announces sellout for 2017 season opener Orlando City stadium Courtesy of Orlando City SC Orlando City's 2017 season opener in the new downtown stadium March 5 against NYCFC is sold out. Tickets are available on resale. Orlando City's 2017 season opener in the new downtown stadium March 5 against NYCFC is sold out. Tickets are available on resale. (Courtesy of Orlando City SC) Alicia DelGallo ’s 2017 season opener March 5 against New York City FC is sold out, the club announced shortly after single-game tickets went on sale Tuesday. 
Tickets to the game are available on resale through TicketExchange, the only site verified by Orlando City, and other third-party websites. 
Single-game tickets to the LA Galaxy match April 15 also sold out within minutes, but an allotment of tickets to that game are included in five-game packages still available. 
The opening-game sellout was expected as limited tickets went on sale to the public. Season ticket holders accounted for 18,000 of the 25,500 seats in the new downtown stadium, while five-game ticket packages, group sales and other presale options filled the majority of the remaining seats prior to Tuesday. 
Demand for the tickets is high as the Lions drew an announced crowd of more than 60,000 people to their 2015 and 2016 season openers. 
“The buzz has been fantastic,” said Chris Gallagher, Orlando City’s vice president of ticket sales. “The fact two games are sold out and others are getting close...we really expect all the games to be sold out at some point this year.” 
Face value for tickets to the opener ranged in price from $35 to $190, according to Gallagher. Tickets available via resale now range in price from $85 for a spot in the supporters section to $2,000 for club-level seats that include food and beverage. 
“That $2,000 listing is just someone who I think is hopeful someone will bite at that price,” Gallagher said. “That’s been up there for weeks.” 
This is a developing story. Check back for updates. Caption Orlando City unveils new home jerseys 
Orlando City unveiled new home jerseys, adopting a new look for its first season playing in a new stadium.

Orlando City forward Hadji Barry and midfielder Richie Laryea talk about the talent of Montverde Academy soccer players after facing the private area boarding and high school in a training scrimmage Saturday. 
Orlando City forward Hadji Barry and midfielder Richie Laryea talk about the talent of Montverde Academy soccer players after facing the private area boarding and high school in a training scrimmage Saturday. Caption Jason Kreis pleased with Orlando City's scrimmage vs Philadelphia 
Orlando City coach Jason Kreis said he saw some progress during the team's preseason scrimmage against the Philadelphia Union, which the Lions won 3-2. 
Orlando City coach Jason Kreis said he saw some progress during the team's preseason scrimmage against the Philadelphia Union, which the Lions won 3-2. Caption Orlando City goalkeeper coach Tim Mulqueen adjusting well to new job 
Orlando City goalkeeper coach Tim Mulqueen, who was hired in January to replace Stewart Kerr, says he is enjoying his new job and fits in well with the rest of the coaching staff. 
Orlando City goalkeeper coach Tim Mulqueen, who was hired in January to replace Stewart Kerr, says he is enjoying his new job and fits in well with the rest of the coaching staff. Caption Brek Shea ready and eager to prove himself with Orlando City in 2017 
Orlando City midfielder Brek Shea says he feels better than he has in a long time a team the start of the 2017 MLS season. He is ready to put last year's shortcomings behind him.
